metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5176 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome before 53.0.2785.113 allows remote attackers to bypass the SafeBrowsing protection mechanism via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-browser-l10n - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-chromedriver - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254').
